intro: Sparaxis roxburghii, commonly known as the African springbok, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces an edible tuberous root that has been traditionally used for food and medicinal purposes. Sparaxis roxburghii is also popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to bloom in spring.
